docs.snippet: The German steamer Standard, Capt. Langen, that arrived yesterday, brought along the Captain and crew of thirteen men of the British bark Claudine, who were rescued in an exhausted condition from the waterlogged vessel....
docs.lead_paragraph: The German steamer Standard, Capt. Langen, that arrived yesterday, brought along the Captain and crew of thirteen men of the British bark Claudine, who were rescued in an exhausted condition from the waterlogged vessel.

headline.main: A NARROW ESCAPE FROM DEATH.; HOW THE CLAUDINE'S CREW WERE RESCUED BY THE STANDARD.

docs.snippet: The officers of the Quebec Steamship Company's steamer Orinoco, which arrived in port yesterday from Bermuda, tell a thrilling story of their experience with the hurricane of Aug. 30 and 31, on their last outward trip. They left here Thursday afte...
docs.lead_paragraph: The officers of the Quebec Steamship Company's steamer Orinoco, which arrived in port yesterday from Bermuda, tell a thrilling story of their experience with the hurricane of Aug. 30 and 31, on their last outward trip. They left here Thursday afternoon, Aug. 28, and experienced perfect weather up to Saturday evening, (the 30th.)

headline.main: CAUGHT IN A HURRICANE.; THE VERY ROUGH EXPERIENCE OF THE STEAMER ORINOCO.

docs.snippet: GREENPORT, L.I., Aug. 3. -- The accident to the steamer Sunshine last night occurred in a heavy fog which hung over Long Island Sound like a huge blanket. It was just 6:45 when the steamer struck. Nothing could be seen over fifty feet away. The bo...
docs.abstract: Sunshine Sunk on Plum Island, Long Island Sound
docs.lead_paragraph: GREENPORT, L.I., Aug. 3. -- The accident to the steamer Sunshine last night occurred in a heavy fog which hung over Long Island Sound like a huge blanket. It was just 6:45 when the steamer struck. Nothing could be seen over fifty feet away. The boat filled rapidly, and the Captain took the only method of preserving the lives of his passengers by beaching the steamer.

headline.main: THE ACCIDENT TO THE SUNSHINE.; PASSENGERS TELL HOW IT OCCURRED -- WHO IS TO BLAME?

docs.snippet: MATTHEW TOWN, Island of Inagua, Oct. 15.-- The American steamship Caroline Miller, Capt. T.C. Ryder, is lying at anchor off this port in a badly disabled condition. She left New-York on Sept. 24 last, bound for St. Marc and other Haytian ports, bu...
docs.abstract: Caroline Miller Disabled; Blockade Running Records
docs.lead_paragraph: MATTHEW TOWN, Island of Inagua, Oct. 15.-- The American steamship Caroline Miller, Capt. T.C. Ryder, is lying at anchor off this port in a badly disabled condition. She left New-York on Sept. 24 last, bound for St. Marc and other Haytian ports, but on Sept. 29, when about two hundred miles north of the island of San Salvador, she broke her crank shaft.

headline.main: AN OLD BLOCKADE RUNNER.; THE CAROLINE MILLER DISABLED AT THE ISLAND OF INAGUA.

docs.snippet: The big iron bark Cassandra of Liverpool, which arrived here Thursday from Plsagua, on the Chilian coast, after a voyage of 123 days, came very near sending the towboat Edgar Baxter to the bottom on Thursday morning....
docs.abstract: Cassandra; Collision with the Edgar Baxter

headline.main: RAN INTO A TUGBOAT.; AN IRON BARK COMES NEAR SENDING THE EDGAR BAXTER TO THE BOTTOM.

docs.snippet: According to a brief and meagre dispatch received yesterday at the Maritime Exchange the British steamship Earnmoor foundered during the great gale on Sept.5, and carried down with her her Captain and most of her crew....

headline.main: A VICTIM OF THE GALE.; THE STEAMSHIP EARNMOOR GOES DOWN WITH MOST OF HER MEN.
